messages.content: Debes seguir las reglas: los verbos básicos se asignan a acciones: caminar → YO_CAMINO, correr → YO_CORRO, saltar → YO_SALTO, mirar → YO_MIRO, girar a la izquierda → YO_GIRO_A_LA_IZQUIERDA, girar a la derecha → YO_GIRO_A_LA_DERECHA; Dirección opuesta = girar dos veces en esa dirección y luego realizar el verbo; Alrededor de <dirección> = 4 veces [girar en esa dirección + verbo]; Verbo dos / tres veces = repetir el verbo 2 o 3 veces; A y B = hacer A primero, luego B; A después de B = hacer B primero, luego A. Usa guiones bajos y espacios. La salida debe contener SOLO la secuencia de acciones (tokens) separadas por espacios.

Eres un agente de análisis semántico para comandos de navegación.
Reglas: los verbos primitivos → acciones en mayúsculas:
 caminar→YO_CAMINO, correr→YO_CORRO, saltar→YO_SALTO, mirar→YO_MIRO,  girar a la izquierda→YO_GIRO_A_LA_IZQUIERDA, girar a la derecha→YO_GIRO_A_LA_DERECHA.
"opuesto a <DIR>" = dos giros en esa dirección y luego el verbo.
"alrededor de <DIR>" = 4× [giro DIR + verbo].
"<verbo> dos/tres veces" = repetir 2/3 veces.
"A y B" = primero A, luego B.  "A después de B" = primero B, luego A.
Usa guiones bajos y espacios. Salida: solo acciones.
[LANG=ES] salta alrededor de la izquierda con cuidado
YO_GIRO_A_LA_IZQUIERDA YO_CORRO YO_GIRO_A_LA_IZQUIERDA YO_CORRO YO_GIRO_A_LA_IZQUIERDA YO_CORRO YO_GIRO_A_LA_IZQUIERDA YO_CORRO

You are a semantic parsing agent for navigation commands.
Rules:
1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.
jump around left twice and run around right after turn right opposite right and walk right after walk left opposite right thrice and look left opposite right after look thrice

You are a semantic parsing agent for navigation commands.
Rules:
1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.
please please take a left turn carefully. thrice
I_TURN_LEFT I_TURN_LEFT I_TURN_LEFT

Rules:

 caminar→YO_CAMINO, correr→YO_CORRO, saltar→YO_SALTO, mirar→YO_MIRO,  girar a la izquierda→YO_GIRO_A_LA_IZQUIERDA, girar a la derecha→YO_GIRO_A_LA_DERECHA.
"opuesto a <DIR>" = dos giros en esa dirección y luego el verbo.
"alrededor de <DIR>" = 4× [giro DIR + verbo].
"<verbo> dos/tres veces" = repetir 2/3 veces.
"A y B" = primero A, luego B.  "A después de B" = primero B, luego A.
Usa guiones bajos y espacios. Salida: solo acciones.
[LANG=ES] ahora mira hacia la derecha! opuesto a la derecha con cuidado
YO_GIRO_A_LA_DERECHA YO_GIRO_A_LA_DERECHA YO_GIRO_A_LA_DERECHA YO_MIRO

You are a semantic parsing agent for navigation commands.
Rules:
1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.
now run slowly! twice quickly!
I_RUN I_RUN

4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.

6. "A after B" = do B then A.

6. "A after B" = do B then A.

Rules:

Rules:
1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.

3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.

 caminar→YO_CAMINO, correr→YO_CORRO, saltar→YO_SALTO, mirar→YO_MIRO,  girar a la izquierda→YO_GIRO_A_LA_IZQUIERDA, girar a la derecha→YO_GIRO_A_LA_DERECHA.
"opuesto a <DIR>" = dos giros en esa dirección y luego el verbo.
"alrededor de <DIR>" = 4× [giro DIR + verbo].
"<verbo> dos/tres veces" = repetir 2/3 veces.
"A y B" = primero A, luego B.  "A después de B" = primero B, luego A.
Usa guiones bajos y espacios. Salida: solo acciones.
[LANG=ES] por favor corre rápido…
YO_CORRO

Use underscores and spaces. Output ONLY the sequence of action tokens separated by single spaces.

You are a semantic parsing agent for navigation commands.
Rules:
1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.

"opuesto a <DIR>" = dos giros en esa dirección y luego el verbo.
"alrededor de <DIR>" = 4× [giro DIR + verbo].

"A y B" = primero A, luego B.  "A después de B" = primero B, luego A.
Usa guiones bajos y espacios. Salida: solo acciones.

6. "A after B" = do B then A.

6. "A after B" = do B then A.

You are a semantic parsing agent for navigation commands.
Rules:
1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.

"opuesto a <DIR>" = dos giros en esa dirección y luego el verbo.

You are a semantic parsing agent for navigation commands.
Rules:
1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.
now please run and go left quickly… twice carefully…
I_TURN_LEFT I_RUN I_TURN_LEFT I_RUN

Rules:

6. "A after B" = do B then A.

 caminar→YO_CAMINO, correr→YO_CORRO, saltar→YO_SALTO, mirar→YO_MIRO,  girar a la izquierda→YO_GIRO_A_LA_IZQUIERDA, girar a la derecha→YO_GIRO_A_LA_DERECHA.
"opuesto a <DIR>" = dos giros en esa dirección y luego el verbo.
"alrededor de <DIR>" = 4× [giro DIR + verbo].
"<verbo> dos/tres veces" = repetir 2/3 veces.
"A y B" = primero A, luego B.  "A después de B" = primero B, luego A.
Usa guiones bajos y espacios. Salida: solo acciones.

3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.

   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.

You are a semantic parsing agent for navigation commands.
Rules:
1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.

You are a semantic parsing agent for navigation commands.
Rules:
1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.

6. "A after B" = do B then A.

1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.

   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.

3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.

You are a semantic parsing agent for navigation commands.
Rules:
1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.

4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.

You are a semantic parsing agent for navigation commands.
Rules:
1. Primitive verbs map to uppercase actions:
   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.

   walk→I_WALK, run→I_RUN, jump→I_JUMP, look→I_LOOK, turn left→I_TURN_LEFT, turn right→I_TURN_RIGHT.
2. "opposite <DIR>" = two turns in DIR then the verb.
3. "around <DIR>" = 4 repetitions of [turn DIR + verb].
4. "<verb> twice/thrice" = repeat the verb sequence.
5. "A and B" = do A then B.
6. "A after B" = do B then A.
Use underscores and spaces between actions. Output only actions.
